ud5.8:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ud5.8:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Ānanda robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Rājagaha for alms.
ud5.8:2.1_0: Devadatta saw him wandering for alms,
ud5.8:2.2_0: so he went up to him and said,
ud5.8:2.3_0: “From this day forth, Reverend Ānanda, I shall perform the sabbath and legal proceedings of the Saṅgha apart from the Buddha and the Saṅgha of mendicants.”
ud5.8:3.1_0: Then Ānanda wandered for alms in Rājagaha.
ud5.8:4.1_0: “Sir, please robe up in the morning and, taking my bowl and robe, entered Rājagaha for alms.
ud5.8:4.2_0: Devadatta saw me wandering for alms,
ud5.8:4.3_0: He went to me and said,
ud5.8:4.4_0: ‘From this day forth, Reverend Ānanda, I shall perform the sabbath and legal proceedings of the Saṅgha apart from the Buddha and the Saṅgha of mendicants.’
ud5.8:4.5_0: “Today, sir, Devadatta will split the Saṅgha. He will perform the sabbath and legal proceedings of the Saṅgha.”
ud5.8:5.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud5.8:6.1_0: “It’s easy for the good to do good,
ud5.8:6.2_0: and hard for the good to do bad.
ud5.8:6.3_0: For the bad doing evil is easy;
ud5.8:6.4_0: For the noble ones doing evil is hard.”
